thread.title: Redskins' Chris Culliver featured in PETA ad for Walk Your Dog Week
thread.title_full: Redskins' Chris Culliver featured in PETA ad for Walk Your Dog Week

title: Redskins' Chris Culliver featured in PETA ad for Walk Your Dog Week
text:
Redskins’ Chris Culliver featured in PETA ad for Walk Your Dog Week Resize Text By Scott Allen October 5 at 3:31 PM Follow @ScottSAllen Chris Culliver tackles Ryan Mathews during Sunday’s win. (Photo by Rob Carr/Getty Images) 
Chris Culliver wasn’t 100 percent, but he suited up anyway in Sunday’s 23-20 win over the Eagles, drawing praise from teammate Ricky Jean Francois . 
Given how he looked while getting beat on a pair of long touchdown passes against Philadelphia and the importance of getting healthy before facing Atlanta’s Julio Jones in Week 5, Culliver shouldn’t have any problem taking it slow during his walks with his four rescue dogs this week. The Redskins cornerback, who is featured in a new PETA ad promoting Walk Your Dog Week , would urge fellow dog owners to do the same. 
“[A] lot of times, we get busy and tied up in things that we’re doing … not giving our animals enough love and care,” Culliver says in a PETA release. “[W]hen you’re walking your dogs, just don’t rush, don’t be on the phone, and take time out to actually bond with your dog.” 
Culliver loves dogs. Last year, his foundation put on a dog show to support the American Bully Kennel Club and he has posted several photos of his own dogs on Instagram. 
Scott Allen writes about all things D.C. sports. Follow him on Twitter @ScottSAllen or e-mail him if you’ve got a tip to share. sports Success! Check your inbox for details. You might also like: Please enter a valid email address Sign Up
